data.title: Where was Secondhand Lions filmed?
data.meta_description: Did you ever wonder which parts of the United States provided a backdrop to Secondhand Lions? Read on to discover where this timeless classic came to life and how to visit the locations!
data.text:
2003

City Locations

Lockhart (USA), Manor (USA), Pflugerville (USA), Austin (USA)

Location Types

House, Restaurant, Estate, Unique

Location Styles

Modern Building, Modern Car, Parking Lot, Helicopter Style

About Secondhand Lions

Tim McCanlies helmed the 2003 comedy-drama Secondhand Lions. The story revolves around Walter, a young boy played by Haley Joel Osment, sent to live with his eccentric great-uncles, Hub (Robert Duvall) and Garth (Michael Caine), in a secluded countryside home. Initially skeptical about the men's mysterious past, Walter soon finds himself caught up in their fascinating tales of adventure and bravery. As the summer unfolds, Walter becomes enthralled by his great-uncles' wild stories of fighting sheiks, discovering hidden treasure, and romancing beautiful princesses. These accounts captivate Walter's imagination and spark his desire to uncover the truth behind their remarkable adventures. With every tale, the bond between the three characters grows, creating a unique family dynamic filled with love, laughter, and valuable life lessons. Amidst the enchanting narratives, Walter also connects with a charming, spirited girl named Mae (played by Emmanuelle Vaugier). Together, they embark on their small-scale adventure, exploring the enchanting wonders of youth and the power of imagination. Walter ultimately learns about courage, loyalty, and embracing life's uncertainties. Watch Secondhand Lions for a world of adventure, laughter, and surprises. It's a timeless tale reminding us of the power of imagination and the extraordinary bonds between generations.

Secondhand Lions Locations

The production of Secondhand Lions primarily happened in and around the beautiful region of Austin, Texas. With its diverse landscapes and stunning landmarks, this area provided the perfect backdrop for the heartwarming story. One notable filming location is the Commodore Perry Estate at 4100 Red River Street in Austin. This historic venue served as Jasmine's palace, adding an enchanting touch to the movie. Coupland, a small town in Williamson County known for its quaint charm, also provided a backdrop for other scenes. The region offers a mix of countryside vistas and rustic settings that complement the storyline's nostalgic feel. Embarking on a trip to the filming locations of Secondhand Lion would undoubtedly be worthwhile for fans. Exploring the Commodore Perry Estate allows visitors to step into the world of Walter, Hub, and Garth, immersing themselves in the magical tales that unfolded within its walls. The surrounding areas of Austin and Coupland offer a chance to experience the distinct Texan charm, with picturesque landscapes, friendly locals, and historical sites. From exploring the vibrant city of Austin to enjoying the peaceful countryside, this journey promises to be a delightful adventure for movie enthusiasts and travelers alike.

As the story unfolds, Hub (Robert Duvall) and Garth (Michael Caine) decide to treat Walter (Josh Lucas) to a delicious lunch at a charming local barbecue joint. However, their peaceful meal soon takes an unexpected turn when rowdy hooligans barges in, causing a commotion. Undeterred by the disturbance, Hub, with his wisdom and calm demeanor, seizes the opportunity to teach the unruly troublemakers a valuable life lesson. In a display of wit and compassion, Hub imparts his wisdom, enlightening the hooligans about the importance of respect, kindness, and the measure of strength. Cele Store in Manor, Texas, is a hidden gem known for its delicious barbecue and live music. Located just 21 miles northeast of Austin, this charming general store offers mouthwatering brisket, sausages, and baby back ribs. With a welcoming atmosphere and excellent service, it's the perfect spot to enjoy a long lunch accompanied by live musical performances. To reach 18726 Cameron Rd, Manor, Texas, follow these directions: From Austin: Take US-290 E/Manor Expy heading northeast, then the exit toward Cameron Rd/Elgin, and turn right onto Cameron Rd. From Pflugerville: Take FM685 N/Kelly Ln heading northeast, turn right onto Old Highway 20, and turn left onto Cameron Rd. Your destination will be on the right from Austin and the left from Pflugerville.

Locate Austin Filming Locations

Following their recent acquisition of a used lion, Hub (Robert Duvall) and Garth (Michael Caine), accompanied by Walter (Josh Lucas), embark on a journey to the Copeland Feed & Milling Co. Their purpose is to procure lion feed for their newfound companion. As they arrive at the establishment, they encounter a quaint building that holds the key to satisfying the dietary needs of their majestic beast. 400 FM 1466, Coupland, TX 78615 is a property in Coupland, Texas. The single-family home, constructed in 1950, covers 792 square feet. While it is not currently available for sale, the property holds historical significance as one of the filming locations for the movie Secondhand Lions in 2003. To get to 400 FM 1466, Coupland, Texas, you can use the following directions: If you are coming from Austin: Take I-35 N/US-290 E, then exit 238B for US-290 E toward Houston, merge onto US-290 E, and right onto TX-277 Spur. Continue straight onto FM 1466 E. After driving for about 0.6 miles, you will reach your destination on the right.

Scout Austin Video Shoot Locations

As Walter (Josh Lucas) listens intently, Garth (Michael Caine) recounts an extraordinary tale of Hub's (Robert Duvall) daring exploits in Africa. Through a captivating flashback, the audience explores an opulent palace where the mesmerizing Princess Jasmine (Emmanuelle Vaugier) discovers the remarkable rescue carried out by a youthful Hub. The Commodore Perry Estate, Auberge Resorts Collection is a luxurious private retreat in Austin, Texas. Reimagined by renowned designer Ken Fulk, the 1928 Italianate mansion offers European elegance and Texan hospitality. With contemporary glamour and whimsical charm, it provides a unique escape from the bustling city. The estate features Lutie's restaurant, offering locally sourced produce and craft cocktails. To reach 4100 Red River St, Austin, TX 78751, you have several transportation options: By car: The address is approximately a 20-minute drive or 9 miles away from Austin-Bergstrom International Airport. Utilize ride-sharing services for convenient and hassle-free transportation. Public transportation: Explore local bus routes or train schedules in Austin to identify the most suitable public transportation option for reaching your destination.

Austin Film Shoot Locations Guide

As Garth (Michael Caine) weaves the tale, Hub (Robert Duvall) and Jasmine (Emmanuelle Vaugier) find themselves immersed in the vibrant atmosphere of an enchanting souk, indulging in the pleasures of shopping. However, their idyllic moment takes a treacherous turn when a group of ruthless mercenaries, dispatched by the menacing Sheik (Adam Ozturk), emerge from the shadows with malicious intent, launching a sudden assault on the unsuspecting couple. The scene unfolds with palpable tension and danger. Symphony Square is a versatile destination that offers personal care and memory support for seniors in Bala Cynwyd, PA. It has an amphitheater which hosts various events, including concerts and weddings. With a rich history dating back to the late 1870s, Symphony Square has become an iconic and vibrant hub in the community. To get to 1111 Red River St, Austin, TX 78701, you have multiple options: By car: Use navigation tools or apps to get directions. Public transportation: Check local bus routes or train schedules in Austin to find the most convenient public transportation option to reach your destination.

Check Austin Production Spaces

Mae (Kyra Sedgwick) drives over a bridge while taking her son Walter (Josh Lucas) to his uncle's house. The bridge is a pivotal moment in the story, symbolizing the journey into the unknown and the start of their adventure with the eccentric uncles Hub and Garth. The CR 456 bridge over Brushy Creek offers a picturesque view of nature's beauty. The bridge, located in a serene setting, provides a tranquil escape from the hustle and bustle of daily life. With sturdy construction and a charming design, it serves as a vital link for pedestrians and vehicles, connecting communities and allowing them to enjoy the peaceful surroundings. To get to the CR 456 bridge over Brushy Creek in Coupland, you can use the following directions: Take the necessary roads to reach Coupland, Texas. Once in Coupland, follow the signs or use a navigation tool to locate CR 456. Drive along CR 456 until you reach the bridge over Brushy Creek.

San Antonio Filming Locations Map

Secondhand Lions, a heartwarming comedy-drama film, took viewers on a journey through various locations in Texas. The film, directed by Tim McCanlies and released in 2003, tells the story of an introverted young boy who spends the summer with his eccentric uncles. One of the notable filming locations was the "Commodore" Perry Estate in Austin, Texas. The estate served as Jasmine's palace, adding an enchanting touch to the movie. Coupland, a small town in Williamson County known for its quaint charm, provided a setting for other scenes. Other locations included Lockhart, Austin, and Pflugerville. The diverse landscapes and landmarks showcased in Secondhand Lions captured the essence of Texas, from the vibrant city of Austin to the peaceful countryside. The filming locations added depth and authenticity to the story, immersing viewers in the nostalgic tale. Overall, Secondhand Lions is a delightful film that entertains and showcases the beauty of Texas and its unique cultural heritage. It is a must-watch for those seeking a heartwarming story set against charming Texan backdrops.
